text: What does your AI product or feature do? Describe its purpose, how it works, and what problem it solves.
regulatoryRelevance: Determines the scope of applicable regulations and risk classification across all jurisdictions.

text: What best describes your AI system's primary function?

options.label: Classifier
options.description: Categorizes inputs into predefined classes (e.g., spam detection, content moderation)

options.label: Recommender
options.description: Suggests items, content, or actions to users

options.label: Generator
options.description: Creates new content (text, images, code, audio)

options.label: Predictor
options.description: Forecasts outcomes or future events

options.label: Detector
options.description: Identifies patterns, anomalies, or specific elements

options.label: Ranker
options.description: Orders or prioritizes items (e.g., search results, candidates)

options.label: Agent
options.description: Autonomous system that takes actions on behalf of users

options.label: Foundation / GPAI model
options.description: A general-purpose AI model trained at scale (e.g., large language model, multimodal foundation model)

options.label: Other
options.description: Does not fit the above categories

regulatoryRelevance: System type influences risk classification under the EU AI Act and determines applicable transparency obligations.

text: What types of data does your system collect or process? Select all that apply.

options.label: Personal data
options.description: Names, email addresses, phone numbers, identifiers

options.label: Sensitive personal data
options.description: Race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, political opinions

options.label: Biometric data
options.description: Fingerprints, facial recognition, voice prints, gait analysis

options.label: Health data
options.description: Medical records, diagnoses, treatment information

options.label: Financial data
options.description: Income, credit scores, bank account details, transaction history

options.label: Location data
options.description: GPS coordinates, IP-based geolocation, address history

options.label: Behavioral data
options.description: Browsing history, usage patterns, engagement metrics

options.label: Minor's data
options.description: Data from or about individuals under 18

options.label: Employment data
options.description: Resumes, performance reviews, compensation, work history

options.label: Criminal records
options.description: Criminal history, arrest records, court proceedings

options.label: Political data
options.description: Political affiliations, voting records, political opinions

options.label: Genetic data
options.description: DNA data, genetic test results

options.label: Public data only
options.description: Publicly available information only

options.label: Anonymized data
options.description: Data that cannot be linked back to individuals

options.label: Pseudonymized data
options.description: Data with direct identifiers replaced by pseudonyms

options.label: Other
options.description: Data types not listed above

regulatoryRelevance: Data types determine GDPR legal basis requirements, trigger DPIA obligations, and affect risk classification under multiple frameworks.

text: Who are the end users or subjects of this AI system? Select all that apply.

options.label: Consumers
options.description: General public using consumer-facing products

options.label: Businesses
options.description: Business clients or enterprise users

options.label: Minors (under 18)
options.description: Children or adolescents

options.label: Employees
options.description: Current employees of the deploying organization

options.label: Patients
options.description: Healthcare patients or medical service recipients

options.label: Students
options.description: Students in educational institutions

options.label: Job applicants
options.description: Candidates applying for employment

options.label: Credit applicants
options.description: Individuals applying for credit or loans

options.label: Tenants
options.description: Current or prospective tenants

options.label: General public
options.description: Unspecified or broad public audience

options.label: Other
options.description: User populations not listed above

regulatoryRelevance: User populations trigger specific protections: minors invoke COPPA/GDPR children's provisions, employees trigger employment AI laws, patients trigger health data rules.

text: Does this system make or influence decisions that materially affect people's rights, access to services, or opportunities?

options.label: Advisory only
options.description: Provides suggestions or information; humans make all final decisions

options.label: Material influence
options.description: Significantly influences decisions about people (e.g., scoring, ranking, filtering)

options.label: Determinative
options.description: Directly makes decisions that affect people's rights, access, or opportunities

regulatoryRelevance: Decision impact level determines obligations under GDPR Article 22 (automated decision-making), EU AI Act risk classification, and US state AI laws targeting consequential decisions.

text: What level of human oversight exists in the system's decision-making process?

options.label: Fully automated
options.description: No human review of individual decisions

options.label: Human-in-the-loop
options.description: A human reviews and approves each decision before it takes effect

options.label: Human-on-the-loop
options.description: A human monitors the system and can intervene, but decisions execute automatically

regulatoryRelevance: Automation level affects GDPR Article 22 applicability, EU AI Act human oversight requirements, and Colorado AI Act disclosure obligations.

text: Which markets do you plan to launch this product in? Select all that apply.

options.label: EU (AI Act)
options.description: European Union — AI Act applies

options.label: EU (GDPR)
options.description: European Union — GDPR data protection applies

options.label: US Federal
options.description: United States federal market (FTC, NIST AI RMF)

options.label: California
options.description: California — CCPA/CPRA, SB 243

options.label: Colorado
options.description: Colorado — Colorado AI Act

options.label: Illinois
options.description: Illinois — BIPA, HRA AI amendment

options.label: New York City
options.description: New York City — LL144 (automated employment decisions)

options.label: Texas
options.description: Texas — TRAIGA

options.label: United Kingdom
options.description: UK — ICO, AISI frameworks

options.label: Singapore
options.description: Singapore — PDPC, Model AI Governance Framework

options.label: China
options.description: China — CAC GenAI measures

options.label: Brazil
options.description: Brazil — LGPD, AI Bill

regulatoryRelevance: Selected markets determine which regulatory frameworks apply and which compliance artifacts and actions are required.
